current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require agencies to quantify costs associated with
		  proposed economically significant regulations, and for other
		  purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Homeland Security and
			 Governmental Affairs

short-title.#text:
Restoring Honesty for our Economy
			 Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

term.#tail: means any authority of the United States that is—

text.#text:
shall include an
			 independent regulatory agency as defined under

means an agency
			 statement of general applicability and future effect, which the agency intends
			 to have the force and effect of law, that is designed to implement, interpret,
			 or prescribe law or policy or to describe the procedure or practice
			 requirements of an agency; and

a
			 regulation issued in accordance with the formal rulemaking provisions of

a
			 regulation that pertains to a military or foreign affairs function of the
			 United States, other than procurement regulations and regulations involving the
			 import or export of non-defense articles and services; or

has an annual
			 effect on the economy of $100,000,000 or more; or

adversely affects
			 in a material way the economy, a sector of the economy, productivity,
			 competition, jobs, the environment, public health or safety, or State, local,
			 or tribal governments or communities.

A proposed economically significant
			 regulation may not be finalized unless the proposed economically significant
			 regulation—

header.#text:
Finalization of
			 proposed economically significant regulations

text.#text:
identifies and
			 quantifies all costs associated with the proposed economically significant
			 regulation; or

describes why it
			 is not possible for the agency to identify or quantify all costs associated
			 with the proposed economically significant regulation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Restoring Honesty for our Economy Act/s:3

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or for the circuit in which such person resides or in which such person's
			 principal place of business is located. Courts of appeals of the United States
			 shall have exclusive jurisdiction of any action to obtain judicial review
			 (other than in an enforcement proceeding) of such an action if any district
			 court of the United States would have had jurisdiction of such action but for
			 this section.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit

text.#text:
Any person may file a
			 petition for judicial review of the agency action required under

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S786 IS: Restoring Honesty for our Economy Act
